reviewText: I remember watching Paddington on Nickelodeon's Pinwheel House. Such a cute series. A little much to watch all at once. This series worked better as it was intended. Between shows, as a filler, but the squee factor is still there. Watching Paddington munching his marmalade sandwiches. Blundering into playful trouble while logically explaining his naive actions. The show's contrast of animation style is unique and pleasing. Thankfully, this set does NOT include the Paddington cel animated series.

summary: A Gem Of A Childhood Treasure
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of those extra special shows that you must own.  The mixed media is not high tech and it shouldn't work but it does. It is like being read a storybook.  Young children will like the visuals and the comforting sound of the reader's voice(s) and that Paddington gets in trouble (like kids do) just because he doesn't understand the consequences of his actions.  The actual humor in the dialogue will usually only be appreciated by adults. Watch these short episodes in order as they are chronological and something in one story may carry over into the next.  I am often shocked at the language of children these days.  Parents should put in this dvd and play it for their very young kids so they would hear and learn an extensive and polite vocabulary. Great for children and world-weary adults.
summary: TAKE BACK YOUR DAUGHTER, IT'S SNOWING  AND SHE HASN'T GOT A DUFFLE COAT

reviewText: I first saw Paddington when Disney owned the rights to distribute VHS tapes with a few of the episodes on it when I was 3 years old. Now all of the episodes are on DVD and for the first time ever I can watch them all crystal clear on a well put together 3 disc set with great features and classic films I can watch with my daughter and I can play some of the games the DVD-ROM carries with her as well. I recommend this DVD to everyone who grew up reading Paddington and watching the series. I hope the other animated version is released very soon.

reviewText: After dealing with some disappointing Mill Creek DVD releases, this Paddington Bear set was a joy indeed. All episodes and specials are represented and are excellent quality. Also contains numerous bonus episodes of two other great stop-motion kids shows, similar in vein to Paddington. A must have set!
Title: N/A

reviewText: One of the first things I did when I got into London for the first time was to head to Paddington Station.  I didn't have much reason to be there, other than--even though I am American--I grew up on the books and cartoons of a certain lovable bear from deepest, darkest Peru.  Paddington Bear contributed to my life-long love of marmalade, and had been a big influence on my going to Britain in the first place.I haven't seen these cartoons for decades, but this Mill Creek boxset was too great to resist.  All 56 episodes from the series, on three DVDs for an extremely affordable price. I always loved the style of the animation, with a stop-motion bear existing in a cartoon world.  The simplicity of the animation adds to its charm, as it mirrors the stories that are simple, honest, and full of love.I am a 40-year old guy without any kids, but I am still touched by the magic of Paddington Bear.  It is more than simple nostalgia; I have been sharing the series with my wife, who has never seem them but loves them as much as I do.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a show that will charm both children and adults. I love the story of this little bear in his duffle coat, oversized hat, and winning personality. My seven-year-old daughter is a fan too, and we have enjoyed reading about his adventures as well as listening to audio CDs about Paddington.When I saw this DVD at our local library, I knew I had to get a copy for my daughter and I - the DVDs make for perfect viewing pleasure on dreary nights or when one isn't feeling too well and in need of some cheer.There are three DVDs in this set, containing all 56 episodes and three half-hour specials of the original stop-motion production:Disc OneEpisodes 1-28Bonus Episodes:Huxley Pig1. At the Circus2. The Haunted House3. The Desert Island4. At the Beach5. Big TopDisc TwoEpisodes 29-56Bonus EpisodesHuxley Pig1. Magician2. Reporter3. Stone-Age4. Space5. FishingDisc Three1. Paddington Birthday Bonanza2. Paddington Goes to School3. Paddington Goes to the MoviesBonus EpisodesThe Wombles1. Orinoco and The Big Black Umbrella2. The Rocking Chair3. A Sticky Ending4. Great Uncle Bulgaria's Keep Fit Lessons5. A Safe PlaceApprox. run time is 8 hours 7 minutes in colorThe DVD-ROM content includes wallpapers and activity pages.In a world saturated with garish, noisy TV programming for children, Paddington Bear is a refreshing ,calming influence, and very welcome indeed.
Title: N/A
